title: How to upload a file
summary: Step-by-step guide for uploading files to the portal.
content: 1. Go to the Upload section. 2. Select your file. 3. Enter your email. 4. Click Upload. 5. Wait for confirmation that your file has been received.

title: What is a remap?
summary: Explanation of remapping and its benefits.
content: Remapping is the process of modifying a vehicle's ECU software to improve performance, efficiency, or both. It allows for adjustments in power, torque, throttle response, fuel efficiency, and more.

title: What file types are supported?
summary: Details on compatible file formats for uploads.
content: Our portal supports BIN, OLS, and ECU read files from most tuning tools. Make sure your file is a clean read and not previously modified, as this ensures accuracy in processing.

title: How do I pay for a file?
summary: Information on payment methods and processing.
content: Once you upload a file, you will be directed to payment options. We support Stripe payments via credit/debit card, Apple Pay, and Google Pay. Payments must be completed before your tuned file is released.

title: What are Stage 1, 2, and 3 remaps?
summary: Explanation of tuning stages and what they involve.
content: Stage 1: Safe performance boost for stock cars. Stage 2: Optimised tuning for cars with supporting hardware upgrades (e.g., exhaust, intercooler). Stage 3: High-performance tuning for heavily modified vehicles, often requiring upgraded turbos and fueling systems.

title: Can I get a dynograph with my file?
content: Yes, we offer digital dynographs that show stock vs tuned performance. This is available as an optional add-on during checkout for £45. The dynograph includes estimated horsepower, torque, and 0–60 mph times.

title: How long does it take to receive my tuned file?
content: Most files are processed and returned within 30–60 minutes during business hours. Complex requests or out-of-hours uploads may take longer. You’ll receive an email notification once your file is ready.

title: Is remapping safe for my car?
content: Yes, if done correctly. Our remaps stay within safe operating limits for your vehicle. Stage 1 files are designed for daily driving reliability. Higher stages may require supporting hardware and proper maintenance.

title: Do you support gearbox maps?
content: Yes, we support gearbox/TCU tuning for many automatic and DSG transmissions. This improves shift times, removes torque limits, and enhances drivability when paired with ECU tuning.

title: What happens if my file upload fails?
content: If your upload fails, try again with a stable internet connection. Ensure your file is in the correct format and under the maximum size limit (20MB). If issues persist, contact support at carnageremaps@gmail.com.

title: How do I contact support?
summary: Ways to get in touch with our team.
content: You can contact us via WhatsApp at +447546371963, by email at carnageremaps@gmail.com, or through the contact form on our website. We aim to reply within 24 hours.

title: What is the Carnage Files portal?
summary: Overview of the file portal service.
content: Carnage Files is a secure online platform for ECU and gearbox tuning file uploads. It allows tuners and clients to upload stock files, pay securely, and receive tuned files quickly and reliably.

title: Can I download my previous files?
content: Yes, logged-in users can access their file history and download previous tuned files from their dashboard. Files are stored securely and linked to your account.

title: What vehicles are supported?
content: We support over 5,000 UK vehicles, including petrol, diesel, hybrid, and electric models. Coverage includes most European brands (VW, Audi, BMW, Mercedes, Ford, etc.) with expanding support for newer ECUs.

title: What if my car has been tuned before?
content: If your ECU has already been tuned, we recommend flashing it back to stock before uploading the file. This ensures a clean base for accurate and stable tuning.
